TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: For most wounds, the overall aim will be healing by primary intention within a specified time frame but there may be some wounds that are allowed to heal by secondary intention and the treatment aim may be wound bed preparation, other intermediate aims which should also be recorded such as reduction in pain, odour etc.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: This records the decisions reached during conversation between the individual and health and care professional about future plans and also records progress.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Any strengths and assets the person has relating to their goals and hopes about their health and well-being.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The coded value associated with the person's strengths. Could be derived from the assessment of the person e.g. 300738008 |Able to participate in leisure activities (finding)|

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: SNOMED CT : - 1127601000000107 | Healthcare matters simple reference set (foundation metadata concept) |

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The person’s strengths (in free text). If the strengths are coded then this is any supplementary or personalised information that relates to the coded strength.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Details of the person needs, concerns or problems

TaggedValue.name: description

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: SNOMED CT : - ^1127581000000103 |Health issues simple reference set|

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The person’s needs, concerns or problems (in free text). If the needs, concerns or problems are coded then this is any supplementary or personalised information that relates to the coded need, concern or problem.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The overall goals, hopes, aims or targets that the person has. Including anything that the person wants to achieve that relates to their future health and wellbeing. Each goal may include a description of why it is important to the person. Goals may also be ranked in order of importance or priority to the person.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The coded value associated with the person's goals, aim's and hopes. e.g. 999002111000000103 |Occupational therapy goals simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)|

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: SNOMED CT : - 413350009|Finding with explicit context| : 246090004|Associated finding| = 300798006 |Able to participate in sporting activities (finding)| , 408729009|Finding context| = 410518001|Goal|

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The person’s goals and hopes (in free text). If the goals and hopes are coded then this is any supplementary or personalised information that relates to the coded goal or hope.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Assessment of the person's motivations to achieve this goal, how important the goal is to the person on a scale of 1-10.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Numeric scale 1 - 10

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Actions or activities the person or others plan to take to achieve the person's goals and the resources required to do this.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: What the action is and how it is to be carried out?

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The coded value for the action.

TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Name and role (e.g. person, carer, GP, OT, etc.) of the person, or a team, carrying out the proposed action, and, if relevant where action should take place.

TaggedValue.value: These are the things to do and people to contact, should an individual’s health or other circumstances get worse.

This may include circumstances where action needs to be taken if a carer is unable to care for the person. A statement of suggested actions. Usually expressed as: in the event of X do Y.

TaggedValue.name: description

TaggedValue.value: This is the content of any additional care and support plan which the person and/or care professional consider should be shared with others providing care and support. May be structured in different ways, e.g. tables, diagrams, images. This is the content of any additional care and support plan which the individual and/or care professional consider should be shared with others providing care and support. It should be structured as recommended for the care and support plan and if contains additional detail, it may be referenced here.

TaggedValue.value: Date and time

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Person’s and carer’s priorities and expectations for treatment, these change over time, NB, person and carer’s objectives may not be consistent, including practicalities, environmental and logistical considerations (transport etc.) These include social preferences, for example being mobile for daughters wedding state of care preferences, for example, reduction of odour or visibility of dressings experience from previous treatments previous equipment experience referred communication method

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: A record to establish what matters to the person in the context of the decision to be made, which may include as appropriate: Person goals or hopes: These are the overall goals, hopes, aims or targets that the person has. Including anything that the person wants to achieve that relates to their future health and wellbeing. Each goal may include a description of why it is important to the person. Goals may also be ranked in order of importance or priority to the person. Values and preferences: The values and/or preferences that the person holds relating to the decision or otherwise. Ideas: Opinions, thoughts, or prior knowledge the person has about their diagnosis, prognosis, or options for treatment, investigations, procedures or other areas they feel are relevant. Concerns: Any worries or fears the person has about their diagnosis (or possible diagnosis) or other areas such as treatment, investigations or procedures that may influence their decision-making or they feel are relevant...

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Experience from the person's experience of treatment of similar conditions

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: A persons experience of using equipment in similar conditions

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Preferences and objectives relating to the treatment of the person, but are stated by a third party, such as next of kin, or carer

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text
